Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Grey-to-White Matter Ratio in Predicting Neurological Outcomes in Heat Stroke

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients over 18 years with heat stroke who underwent cranial CT.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the prognostic value of the grey-to-white matter ratio (GWR) in predicting neurological outcomes in heat stroke patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was neurological status at discharge, assessed by CPC scores.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This multicentre retrospective study included 128 heat stroke patients from five hospitals in China between January 2020 and November 2023.

Result_Outcome.evidence: All GWRs were significantly lower in the poor outcome group (CPC 3–5) than in the good outcome group (CPC 1–2).
